snippet.title: Fighting for farmers in Ghana
snippet.description:
Ghana is a developing nation full of promise and a reputation to uphold as “The Gateway to Africa.” In this new Alliance for Science video, we follow the life of John Dzwiornu, a rice farmer and 2016 Alliance for Science Global Leadership Fellow, who has become a strong advocate of farmer’s rights and the need for access to better agricultural technology, a position he champions as vice president of the Ghanaian Association of Farmers and Fishermen.

#Ghana #farming #biotechnology

snippet.title: Hawaii GMO Papaya: Real Solutions, Real Lives
snippet.description:
Dialogue, discussion and the success of the genetically engineered papaya offer solutions to the conflict over GMO agriculture that has polarized communities in Hawaii.

#GMOs #GMOpapaya #Hawaii

snippet.title: Boosting Yields by Improving Photosynthesis: Steve Long
snippet.description:
Professor Steve Long and his team at Realizing Improved Photosynthetic Efficiency (RIPE) project are focusing their energy on helping plants boost yields by improving the efficiency of plant photosynthesis. 

The team hopes transfer this success to food crop staples such as rice, cassava and the African legume cowpea.

You can learn more about the process here https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Av0dTk9KzlY

#agriculture #photosynthesis #crops

snippet.description:
Meet the 2016 Cornell Alliance for Science Global Leadership Fellows as they discuss their commitment to help farmers and end world hunger through the tools of biotechnology.

snippet.title: I've got the gene for you! The science behind making parasite-resistant cattle
snippet.description:
As African farmers suffer financial hardship from crop losses caused by climate change, scientists seek to reduce poverty through a genetic solution to sleeping sickness in cattle.

See Part 1 where Dr Jayne Raper explains the importance of making parasite-resistant cattle to help reduce poverty in Sub-Saharan Africa: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h6S0mcSJ-34

snippet.title: Making disease-resistant cattle in Africa
snippet.description:
As African farmers suffer financial hardship from crop losses caused by climate change, Dr. Jayne Raper and other scientists seek to reduce poverty through a genetic solution to sleeping sickness in cattle. 

See Dr Jayne Raper's science behind making parasite-resistant cattle: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2rEt4x1RvzU

#geneticengineering #farming #animalagriculture

snippet.title: AquAdvantage Salmon: The World's Most Sustainable Salmon?
snippet.description:
Though vilified by anti-GMO activists as dangerous, no human food has been more carefully scrutinized than the AquAdvantage® Salmon. The fast-growing fish also provides a way to produce quality protein locally and sustainably in land-locked systems — an important consideration in the face of climate change impacts on ocean resources.

#aquadvantage #salmon #agriculture

snippet.title: Pursuing a Dream: Tackling Climate Change and Soil Salinity
snippet.description:
Dr. Ashwani Pareek, and his wife Dr. Sneh Pareek, are Indian scientists who have both dedicated their research to studying how plants can adapt to the stresses of drought and salinity. Dr. Ashwani Pareek hopes to one day use this technology to help farmers in his home village of Sambhar, and elsewhere  in India, grow the traditional crops that they can no longer grow due to increasingly poor soil in area.

#climatechange #farming #india

snippet.description:
An update on crop biotechnology in Burkina Faso:
Forum international sur la bio technologie Burkina Faso

snippet.title: Bt Brinjal in Bangladesh: Farmers' Perspectives
snippet.description:
Bangladeshi farmers discuss their success growing Bt brinjal, a new variety of genetically modified eggplant that is resistant to the fruit and shoot borer pest.

#farming #bangladesh #gmos

snippet.title: Farmer Perspectives: Ron Sass
snippet.description:
Ron Sass, a corn and soybean farmer from northeast Iowa, discusses how agricultural biotechnology has helped his family farm, and how it would benefit farmers in the developing world.

#farming #gmocrops #biotechnology

snippet.title: GMO feed safe for animals - Alison Van Eenennaam
snippet.description:
About 95 percent of all U.S. livestock eat GMO feed.  This GMO feed, and the animals that consume it, are safe, says Dr. Alison Van Eenennaam, Cooperative Extension Specialist in Animal Biotechnology and Genomics at the University of California – Davis. Studies have found no detrimental effects on animals from consuming GE feed, and no changes in their productivity or health.

#gmos #livestock #foodsafety

snippet.title: Status of Agricultural Biotechnology in Nigeria - Rose Gidado
snippet.description:
Dr. Rose Gidado, Assistant Director of the National Biotechnology Development Agency, discusses the status of cassava and cowpea in Nigeria. 

#biotechnology #nigeria #nutrition

snippet.title: Biotech and Food Security in Africa — Chiedozie Egesi
snippet.description:
Chiedozie Egesi discusses the importance of biotechnology in addressing food security in Nigeria.

#biotechnology #nigeria #nutrition

snippet.title: Africa Needs Biotech Crops
snippet.description:
Daniel Otunge, coordinator of the Open Forum on Agricultural Technology, discusses the critical need for biotechnology and innovation in Africa.

#biotechnology #gmos #africa

snippet.title: Jennifer Thomson on biotech in Africa and Europe
snippet.description:
Dr. Jennifer Thomson, Professor of Microbiology, University of Cape Town, discusses how European views on biotech influence policy in Africa, and the importance of listening to the voices of African farmers on this issue.

#gmos #biotechnology #africa

snippet.title: Fighting the blight: New hope for the American chestnut
snippet.description:
Genetic engineers and thousands of average citizens are working together to restore the iconic American chestnut.

Read more at http://allianceforscience.cornell.edu/blog/american-chestnut-enduring-classic and visit The American Chestnut Research and Restoration Project at http://www.esf.edu/chestnut/

#geneticengineering #americanchestnut #savethetrees

snippet.title: Sacrificing for Science
snippet.description:
Dr. Jennifer Thomson discusses the hard choices that faced many women when she embarked on a career in science.

#womeninscience #science #allianceforscience

snippet.title: Precision Breeding Offers New Alternative to Dehorning Cattle
snippet.description:
Holstein dairy cows typically have their horns removed ("disbudded") when they are calves. 

Scientists have now discovered a way of using precision breeding techniques to make the typically-horned Holstein naturally polled (hornless) thus avoiding the uncomfortable disbudding procedure.

#biotechnology #animalwelfare #dairyfarming

Credits:

Video: Hannah Smith Walker & Jeremy Veverka
Editing: Jeremy Veverka
Production Assistant: Shailee Shah

For more information, please visit: http://allianceforscience.cornell.edu/

snippet.title: Alliance for Science Global Leadership Fellows Program
snippet.description:
In Fall 2015, 25 emerging leaders from around the world came to Cornell University to participate in the inaugural Alliance for Science Global Leadership Fellows Program. A diverse group representing 10 nations, they were united in their passion to end world hunger through the use of science and evidence-based policies for food and agriculture.

#allianceforscience #globalleadershipfellows #biotechnology

snippet.title: Bt Eggplant: A new option for farmers in Bangladesh
snippet.description:
Bangladeshi farmers dreaming of a better life find hope in the successful field demonstrations of Bt brinjal — eggplant genetically engineered to resist destructive pests. 

The project was made possible through the cooperative efforts of the Agricultural Biotechnology Support Project II, Cornell University, Bangladesh Agricultural Research Institute and Bangladesh farmers, with funding by USAID.

For more information, visit: http://allianceforscience.cornell.edu/

#gmos #btbrinjal #bangladesh

snippet.description:
Michelle Miller, aka Farm Babe (https://www.facebook.com/IowaFarmBabe) and Iowa farmer Doug Sass talk about Michelle's transition from city girl to a farmer and her efforts to promote direct dialogue between farmers and the public.

#farming #allianceforscience #biotechnology

snippet.title: The Cornell Alliance for Science: Our Story
snippet.description:
The Alliance for Science is a communications-based non-profit organization represented by scientists, NGOs, journalists and concerned citizens from around the world who have come together to tell stories that restore the importance of scientific evidence in decision-making.

Learn what the Cornell Alliance for Science is all about and become a Science Ally. Make a difference in the world today! hhttps://allianceforscience.cornell.edu/resources/join-us/ 

#allianceforscience #scicomm #biotechnology

snippet.title: Genetically engineering goats to get better milk
snippet.description:
UC Davis professor Dr James Murray and PhD candidate Lydia Garas discuss transgenic goat milk research that if approved, could help treat diarrheal infections and inflammatory bowel disease.

For more information, please visit: http://allianceforscience.cornell.edu/

Special thanks: Rachel Conway and UC Davis

#geneticengineering #goats #animalagriculture

snippet.title: Protecting crops using genes from garlic and onions
snippet.description:
Dr. Sampa Das from the Division of Plant Biology, Bose Institute, India, discusses how her research team is using lectin from garlic to protect other crops from pests and diseases.

#crops #geneticengineering #gmos

snippet.title: Obstacles to Accessing Agricultural Technology in India
snippet.description:
Currently, Indian farmers can access just one seed technology: Bt cotton. Agricultural leaders in India, like G.S. Mann and G. Sidhu, question why they can't use technologies available in the West. 

Mann and Sidhu argue for greater access based on their experience of higher yields and lower pesticide use with Bt cotton. Learn more at http://bit.ly/1KOY1HI

#GMOs #biotechnology #India #BtCotton #science

snippet.title: Keith Kloor on How Cultural Brokers Shape the #GMOdebate
snippet.description:
Journalist Keith Kloor gives a lecture on March 23rd, 2015 on the Cornell University campus entitled "How Cultural Brokers Shape the GMO Debate".

#GMOs #gmodebate #science #biotechnology

snippet.title: Bill Nye the Science Ally changed his mind on GMOs - you should too!
snippet.description:
Bill Nye checked the science and changed his mind on #GMOs, choosing science over ideology. 

#GMOdebate #science #BillNye

snippet.title: Fighting Banana Bacterial Wilt in Uganda
snippet.description:
Banana Bacterial Wilt (BBW) is a disease devastating East African Highland Banana crops.  In the case of BBW, a team of scientists at the National Agricultural Research Organisation (NARO) in Uganda have developed a banana variety that, using biotechnology, is resistant to Bacterial Wilt, offering the best hope for combatting the disease.

We would like to acknowledge the following groups for their contributions in producing this video:

Uganda Biosciences Information Center (UBIC)
www.UgandaBIC.org

National Agricultural Research Organisation of Uganda (NARO)
www.naro.go.ug

The Government of Uganda

The Farming Community

Cornell Alliance for Science
allianceforscience.cornell.edu

For more information, please visit: http://allianceforscience.cornell.edu/

#gmos #GMOdebate #science #biotechnology #farmers

snippet.title: Alianza para la Ciencias #GatesLetter La Gran Apuesta
snippet.description:
En su carta anual este 2015, Bill y Melinda Gates, hacen una “Gran Apuesta” para los próximos 15 años: que debido a los avances en los sectores de la salud, agricultura, banca, y la educación, la vida de las personas viviendo en países pobres mejorará más rápido en estos 15 años que en cualquier otro momento en el pasado. Nosotros en la Alianza para las Ciencias queremos hacer un seguimiento, apostando que hasta el año 2030, el acceso a las innovaciones agrícolas mejorara al medioambiente, contribuirá a la seguridad alimenticia, y mejorará la calidad de vida a nivel mundial. Únete a la conversación en Twitter y en otras redes sociales, utilizando el hashtag #GatesLetter y compartiendo tus “Grandes Apuestas” para el 2030 con @ScienceAlly.

Narration/Translation by Valeria San Juan

snippet.title: Muungano wa Sayansi #GatesLetter Big Bet Challenge
snippet.description:
Sisi katika Muungano wa sayansi ni azimio letu
kwamba miaka kumi na tano kutoka sasa bioteknolojia za kilimo zinazokuzwa
na wanasayansi wa sekta ya umma
zitaleta maendeleo katika maisha ya watu duniani.
Miaka kumi na tano kutoka sasa wakulima wote duniani watapanda mimea ambayo
inahitaji dawa chache za wadudu wa mimea na viongezi vya kemikali.
Nao mchele ndizi na mihogo iliyoimarishwa kibiolojia
itaboresha lishe kwa mabilioni ya watu. 
Mbiringanya na kunde zenye BT zitapunguza matumizi ya dawa za wadudu wa mimea 
hivyo basi kunufaisha wakulima, watumizi wa mazao na mazingira.
Mimea nayo itastawi katika hali ya hewa isiyotabirika
kwa hivyo kuhimili joto ukame wadudu na magonjwa 
na pia kuweza kutumia kwa ufanisi zaidi
rasilimali chache kama nitrojeni na maji.
Sisi katika Muungano wa sayansi ni azimio letu
kwamba katika miaka kumi na tano kutoka sasa watu kutoka kila sehemu 
watakuwa wameweza kutumia mbinu bunifu 
ambazo zitaboresha mazingira, usalama wa chakula  
na pia maisha duniani.

Narrated by: Angela Siele

Special thanks: Tom Mbega

snippet.title: How Ag Biotech Will Be Changing Lives in 2030
snippet.description:
In their 2015 Annual Letter (http://www.gatesnotes.com/2015-annual-letter?page=0&lang=en&WT.mc_id=01_21_2015_AIN_EM_domain_Top_13), Bill and Melinda Gates make a "Big Bet" for the next 15 years: That thanks to breakthroughs in health, farming, banking, and education, the lives of people in poor countries will improve faster in the next 15 years than in any other time in history. We at the Alliance for Science want to follow up, betting that by 2030, access to agricultural innovations will specifically improve the environment, contribute to a more food secure world, and improve livelihoods globally. Join the conversation on Twitter and other social media outlets by using the hashtag #GatesLetter and by sharing your Big Bets for 2030 with @ScienceAlly.

#GMOs #gmodebate #science #biotechnology #agriculture

snippet.title: William Powell American Chestnut Lecture
snippet.description: Lecture given at Cornell University on October 21, 2014. Presented by William Powell, Co-Director of the American Chestnut Research & Restoration Project. http://www.esf.edu/chestnut/

snippet.title: Mark Lynas on anti-GMO campaigns and the potential for public-sector biotechnology
snippet.description:
We Interviewed Mark Lynas about misconceptions around molecular biology in plant breeding and about the potential benefits of using biotechnology to produce food with more benefits to farmers and consumers and less environmental consequences.

Mark Lynas was a former anti-GMO activist but has since dramatically changed his position on the technology.  Mark Lynas is the author of several books on the environment, including High Tide, Six Degrees, and The God Species.  He was the climate change advisor to the President of the Maldives between 2009 and 2011. In October 2013 he was appointed a Visiting Fellow at Cornell University’s Office of International Programs at the College of Agriculture and Life Sciences. He is also a member of the advisory board of the science advocacy group Sense About Science, and is a member of the World Economic Forum’s Global Agenda Council on Decarbonising Energy, which focuses on sustainable energy to mitigate climate change.

#gmos #gmodebate #science #marklynas

snippet.title: Unbundle GMOs: Promoting Rational Conversation about Biotechnology
snippet.description:
"Sticks in a Bundle Cannot Be Broken"

Treating "GMOs" as a bundled concept makes it difficult to evaluate them on a case by case basis.

What traits are being modified?
Who benefits?
Are there environmental risks?
What are the alternatives?

Zero tolerance towards GMOs prevents rational conversations.  This keeps people from being able to make informed decisions about the food they purchase or grow.

Agriculture is facing enormous challenges. The climate is changing, water and land are becoming scarce, new diseases and pests threaten crops worldwide, and hundreds of millions of people still don't have access to adequate nutritious food.

The Cornell Alliance for Science believes science can help solve these challenges.  We need to disaggregate the GMO concept so that farmers and consumers really know what's in their food.

For more information - visit http://allianceforscience.cornell.edu

Animation by Evan Clayburg
Sound Design by Chris Knight
Music - "ShallowPal" - Auditone Music Library

#gmos #gmodebate #biotechnology #farmers #science

snippet.title: BT Cotton in India - The Farmer's Perspective
snippet.description:
Gurjeet Singh Mann owns Mann Farms based out of Sirsa, India.  He describes his experiences with growing BT Cotton and the environmental benefits that have resulted after reducing pesticide use.

For more information, visit: http://allianceforscience.cornell.edu/

#gmos #science #biotechnology #farmers #india

snippet.title: Can Biotechnology Help Save Citrus?
snippet.description:
Ricke Kress is the President of Southern Gardens Citrus.  He talks about a new disease that is ravaging citrus operations in Florida and how biotechnology may be able to save our citrus. 

#biotechnology #agriculture #science #gmos

snippet.title: Zero-Pesticide BT Eggplant Farming in Gazipur, Bangladesh
snippet.description: Our Interview with Munsur Sarker who is growing BT Eggplant in Gazipur, Bangladesh as part of the crop's limited release.  He describes how he's able to grow the crop without the use of harmful pesticides because of its resistance to insect pests. #gmos #science #BtBrinjal #farmers
